question: Most common neonatal disorder screened is:
exp: Most common neonatal disorder to be screened is Neonatal hypothyroidism (NNH) Blood sample is collected from Cord's Blood /fromheel prick after 24hrs of bih Test- measurement of T4 or TSH /both simultaneously. As a single method, T4 is more useful (greater precision and reproducibility) Congenital Hypothyroidism is one of the most common preventable cause of mental retardation. Hence, neonatal screening & early supplementation of thyroid hormones can prevent this mental retardation.
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Field instrument used to measure bih weight:-
exp: - Field instrument to measure bih weight is Salter's Spring balance (kind of sling balance on which child is hung) - Average bih weight = 2. 8kg - According to WHO, Low bih weight = < 2. 5kg Very Low bih weight = < 1. 5 Kg Extremely Low bih weight = < 1 Kg - Bih weight Doubles by 5 months Triples by 12 months Quadruples by 2yrs
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Most abundant immunoglobulin present in breast milk?
exp: Most abundant type of Ig = IgA > IgD > IgG, IgM & IgE Anti-infective factors present in breast milk are: IgA (ratio of IgA: IgG is 100: 1) Lymphocytes Anti- streptococcal factor Lysosome Lactoferrin Living cells.
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Which of the following is known as 'the medical discovery of 20th century'?
exp: Oral Rehydration Therapy (O), a cheap and effective way to tackle moality from diarrohea Hence, it is 'The medical discovery of the century' composition of Reduced Osmolarity ORS - Na+ 75 mmol /L K+ 20 mmol /L Cl- 65 mmol/L Citrate 10 mmol/L Glucose 75 mmol/L Total 245 mmol/L
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Exclusive breast feeding is recommended by WHO upto age of:-
exp: WHO recommendations on breast feeding in developing countries: Exclusive breast feeding: Upto age of 6 months. Breast feeding: Upto age of 2 years. Vaccines, Medications, Vitamin supplementation are permitted in exclusive breast feeding.
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: With respect to Facility Based Newborn Care (FBNC), which of the following facility exists at MCH Level I (SC & PHC) for care of newborn at bih:
exp: Facility Based Newborn Care (FBNC) Newborn Care Facility MCH Level Health Facility Newborn Care Corner (NBCC) I SC, PHC Newborn Stabilization Unit (NBSU) II CHC, FRU Special Newborn Care Unit (SNCU) III District Hospital
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Breast milk can be stored in refrigerator (without spoiling) upto:-
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Shakir's tape is used in age group of:-
exp: Mid Arm Circumference:- Field instrument used to measure Mid arm circumference is Shakir's tape Used in age group 6 months to 5years. Normal value is > 13. 5cms Mild to moderate PEM = 12. 5 -13. 5 cms Severe PEM = <12. 5 cms
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: "Baby-friendly hospital initiative" (BFHI), created and promoted by WHO and _____
exp: A new "baby-friendly hospital initiative" (BFHI) is created and promoted by WHO and UNICEF. The initiative is a global effo to implement practices that protect, promote and suppo breastfeeding.
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: What is the content of Pediatric iron folic acid tablet supplied under the reproductive and child health programme?
exp: A pediatric tablet/syrup of IFA contains: 20 mg elemental iron and 100 mcg folic acid (to be given for 100 days minimum every year till 5 years age of child) biweekly. An IFA tablet of Pregnant female contains: 60 mg elemental iron, 500 mcg folic acid (to be given for 180 days minimum in pregnancy and 180 days during lactation).
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Breastfeeding must be initiated within:-
exp: According to WHO guidelines, initiate breast feeding After a normal vaginal delivery: Within 1 hour After a cesarean section: Within 4 hours Current recommendation: Sta breast feeding as early as possible ASAP. (Do not wait for 1 hour or 4 hours)
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Weight of a newborn triples at the age of:-
exp: Average bih weight in India: 2. 8 kg. (2. 7-2. 9 kg) Bih weight doubles at 5 months, triples by 1 year and quadruples by 2 years of age. Minimum expected weight gain per month: 500 grams. Height- average bih length in India- 50 cm Height at the end of infancy- 75 cm height doubles by 4 years
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: As compared to Cow's milk, Human milk has:
exp: Human milk contains higher quantities of Lactose Iron water Vit- A, C Cysteine, Taurine Linoleic acid, lenolenic acid, PUFA Casein: whey ratio Cow milk contain high quantities of Energy Proteins Fats Vit-B, D Na+, K+ Methionine Casein: whey ratio Hence, Comparative contents of nutrients given: Protein: Cow > Human Lactose: Human > Cow Iron: Human > Cow Vitamin: Human > Cow
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding

question: Integrated Management of Childhood Illness (IMCI) was taken to prevent morbidity and moality from all except:
exp: INTERGRATED MANAGEMENT OF CHILDHOOD ILLNESS (IMCI): IMCI is a 'strategy for reducing morbidity and moality associated with major causes of childhood illness' Curative component includes management of: Diarrhoea Measles (&otitis media) Pneumonia Malaria Malnutrition
topic_name: Paediatric Care in RCH: BW, BL, PEM, Breast Feeding
